name: Michelle Fullwood
body:
My life revolves around words, language, stories. My projects are usually tools to help language learners or data science projects that help me explore my passions.

## Current projects

* Linguistic Magic (under construction). Khan Academy for language learning. Initial target language: Mandarin Chinese. Features:
   * Promotes correct mental models and language learning strategies
   * A novel way of learning characters that breaks them into components from the very beginning
   * Pronunciation training (especially of tones) from day 1, using High Variability Phonetic Training
   * Plenty of reading and listening input
   * Vocabulary is re-introduced in spaced repetition cycles so that learner sees vocabulary multiple times in different contexts
   * A mix of different activities so that the learner never gets bored
   * Tools used: Flask, Elm, PostgreSQL, JavaScript
* Writing advice advice (data collection stage)
   * Empirically determine whether writing advice (e.g. adverbs are evil) actually works, using a database of fan fiction.
   * Also explore other factors that make a story more or less popular in fandom (e.g. are slash stories better reviewed?)
   * Tools used: requests, BeautifulSoup, Pandas, R, scikit-learn, PyMC3, NLTK, TextBlob, pattern.en, spaCy, gensim

## Past projects

* [Fuzzy Arabic Dictionary](http://fuzzyarabic.herokuapp.com/)
   * A dictionary of Arabic you can use even if you don't know how to spell
   * [Blog](http://michelleful.github.io/code-blog/2014/03/25/fuzzy-arabic-dictionary/)
   * Tools: Yamli, Buckwalter Morphological Analyzer, JavaScript, Flask
* [A linguistic street map of Singapore](https://michelleful.cartodb.com/viz/b722485c-dbf6-11e4-9a7e-0e0c41326911/embed_map)
   * A street map of Singapore in which every road is colour-coded with the language of origin of its road name
   * [Blog](http://michelleful.github.io/code-blog/2015/04/24/sgmap/) (7 posts)
   * Tools: GeoPandas, scikit-learn, OpenStreetMap, mplleaflet, CartoDB
* [Twide and Twejudice](https://rawgit.com/michelleful/NaNoGenMo/master/twide_and_twejudice.html)
   * Pride and Prejudice with the dialogue replaced by a word used in a similar way on Twitter
   * My entry into NaNoGenMo 2014
   * [Blog](http://michelleful.github.io/code-blog/2014/12/07/nanogenmo-2014/)
   * Tools used: TweetNLP, Python
   * Sample paragraph: *"Miss Elizabeth Bennet!" repeated Miss Bingley. "I am all neurosis. How loooooooong has shhe been suuuch a sxey?"*
* [Stressifier](http://stressifier.herokuapp.com/)
    * A tool that helps English learners figure out where to put primary stress
    * [Blog](http://michelleful.github.io/code-blog/2014/07/23/stressifier/)
    * Tools: CMU pronouncing dictionary (syllabified by Penn Phonetics Laboratory), m2m-aligner, Flask
